meanings.sent1: During the meeting, he raised a quibble about the font size on the presentation slides.
meanings.sent2: Her constant quibbles about the office temperature were starting to annoy her coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The quibble over who should make the coffee in the morning became a daily routine.
meanings.sent4: Their quibble over the color of the curtains seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The persistent quibble about the meeting time made everyone frustrated.

meanings.definition: To argue or raise objections about a trivial matter
meanings.sent1: She would always quibble about the smallest details in their plans.
meanings.sent2: They tend to quibble over insignificant issues instead of focusing on the main goal.
meanings.sent3: He would quibble playfully with his friends about who owed whom a favor.
meanings.sent4: The siblings would quibble over who got to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent5: Don't quibble over the price; just pay for it and let's go.

meanings.sent1: Their quibble over which movie to watch led to a long discussion.
meanings.sent2: The siblings often engage in silly quibbles over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The quibble between the two friends about who won the game was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The quibble between the neighbors about the property line escalated quickly.
meanings.sent5: The quibble between the students about the best study method was finally settled by the teacher.
